utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aaargh. What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Emergency preparedness drill.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, no, come on!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, you know how it works. Once a quarter, keep our readiness up. Now, rise and shine, sleepy head. Half the town is probably dead.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I have to get a lock for my door.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think you’ll like the drill tonight. I’ve tried to make it fun. Each of these cards contains a detailed scenario of a possible apocalyptic event. Everything from wild fires to a surprise invasion by Canada. Pick a catastrophe, any catastrophe.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sheldon, Canada is not going to invade California.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, really? You think those hippies in Washington and Oregon can stop them?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All righty! An 8.2 magnitude earthquake devastates Pasadena, reducing mighty edifices to dust, engulfing the city in flames. The streets flow with blood and echo with the cries of the wounded. Oh, excellent choice. Now, put on your hard hat and safety vest.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, fun. I get to spend another night in front of our apartment dressed like one of the Village People.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You make that joke every three months. I still don’t get it. Leonard, wait. What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know, what am I doing?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Look around you, there’s hypothetical broken glass everywhere. Really? You’re going to face Armageddon without your orthotics? All right, your choice. Uh-oh, hypothetical aftershock!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Aah!

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And that’s why we wear hard hats.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Check it out, press release from NASA.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Um, Expedition 31 will launch this spring to the International Space Station. Crew members will include Commander Tom ‘Tombo’ Johnson, astronaut Mike ‘Supernova’ Novacelik and Payload Specialist Howard Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: This is going right into my synagogue’s newsletter.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, if you’re going to be an astronaut, you need to pick a cool nickname.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t get to pick it. The other guys have to give it to me.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh. If I had one, it would be Brown Dynamite.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Are you not listening to me? The other astronauts have to give you your nickname.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Are you not looking at me? I am Brown Dynamite. Why do you put six sugars in your coffee?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Because the cafeteria doesn’t offer little packets of methamphetamine.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Emergency drill night last night, huh?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-huh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: How’d you do?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll tell you exactly how he did. Readiness: unsatisfactory. Follows direction: barely. Attitude: a little too much. Overall: not only will he probably die in a fiery inferno, his incessant whining would most certainly spoil everyone else’s day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what, I’m so tired I can’t even think straight. I’m going home. Will one of you guys give this nutbag a ride back later?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You can’t go home. You have to take me to the dentist at four o’clock.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, can’t you take the bus to the dentist?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course I can. It’s coming back under the residual effects of the anaesthesia, that’s the problem. Two years ago after a deep gum cleaning, I thought I got on a bus but somehow wound up on a booze cruise to Mexico.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: They put you under for a cleaning?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, they have to, I’m a biter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whatever, Sheldon. I’m exhausted. I’m not taking you to the dentist.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wrong, sir. Wrong. Under section 37B of the roommate agreement, miscellaneous duties, you are obligated to take me to the dentist. See? It’s right here after providing a confirmation sniff on questionable dairy products.”

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You know what, I am sick of the roommate agreement. It’s ridiculous. I’m your roommate, not your chauffeur. You know, I had better things to do yesterday than drive you all the way to the good model train store in Garden Grove because the one in Pasadena has gotten too big for its britches.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, it has. Ask anybody.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t care. I’m done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hold on. Are you saying that you want to invoke Clause 209?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I don’t know what that is, but if it means I can go home and sleep, then yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Think carefully here. Clause 209 suspends our friendship, and strips down the roommate agreement to its bare essentials. Our responsibilities toward each other would only be rent, utilities and a perfunctory chin jut of recognition as we pass in the hall. ‘Sup?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Where do I sign?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Right here. Use your finger.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There. Done.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: All right. That’s it. We are now no longer companions, boon or otherwise. We are now merely acquaintances. To amend the words of Toy Story, you have not got a friend in me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m gonna go home and take a nap.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, tell it to someone who cares.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I got pretty exciting NASA news today. Next week I fly to Houston for orientation and zero-gravity elimination drills.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What does that mean?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: He’s gonna learn to poop in space.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Open the pod bay doors, HAL.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe your nickname should be Brown Dynamite.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, dear friends. And Dr. Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: ‘Sup?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: ‘Sup? My apologies. I would’ve been here sooner, but the bus kept stopping for other people to get on it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I saved you a dumpling.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, your concern for me is touching. It will serve you well when you take me to the dentist tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry, Sheldon, I’m busy. I’m right in the middle of my addiction study. I’ve got a lab full of alcoholic monkeys, and tomorrow’s the day we switch them to O’Doul’s.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You’re my girlfriend and you’re not going to cater to my every need? Oh, where’d the magic go?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, that’s not what girlfriends are for. Although, you don’t use them for what they’re for, so what do I know?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard doesn’t make me do his shopping, or take him to the dentist, or pick up his dry cleaning, right?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Absolutely. But when Ma’s hips give out, you’re up, kid.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, if Amy’s too busy, that gives the rest of you an opportunity to make my life easier, thus assuring yourselves a footnote in my memoirs, tentatively entitled You’re Welcome, Mankind. All right, then, just shout when you hear the task you want to undertake. Uh, dentist. Okay, we can circle back to that one. Um, well, who wants to take me Wednesday morning to get new heels put on my dress shoes? Anyone? Oh. That one had hoot written all over it. Um, all right, uh, dermatologist? Allergist? Podiatrist? Supercuts? Okay, okay, here’s a fun one. Um, I need a new picture frame and I have a hankering for Swedish meatballs. Who wants to spend the day with me at IKEA?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Their meatballs are pretty good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What’s that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nothing, nothing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello, Stuart.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, hey, Sheldon. Can I help you find something today?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No, no. I was just sitting at home thinking about how it might be nice to catch up with my ninth favourite person.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Ninth?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You moved up one. My pen pal in Somalia was kidnapped by pirates. So, uh, how are you?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Uh, not so good. My shrink just killed himself and blamed me in the note.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. Great. So, what’s new with your family? How’s your mother? Is she alive?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And your father? Alive?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: How about your grandparents, they alive?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so sorry for your loss. On a cheerier note, I have a teeth-cleaning appointment this afternoon. What do you say you take me over there, buddy boy?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I’m sorry, you want me to take you to the dentist?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. And now, I can’t make any promises, but that’s the sort of thing that gets a fella on the short list for the number eight friend slot.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sheldon, I’m working. I can’t take you to the dentist. Also, and I can’t stress this enough, I don’t want to take you to the dentist.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Can’t help a friend out in a time of need, huh? I see where your therapist was coming from.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh! What about we make your astronaut nickname Howard “Buzz” Wolowitz?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You can’t do Buzz. Buzz is taken.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Buzz Lightyear is not real.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No, that’s not what I’m talking about.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, are you talking about when he thought he was real?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, um, how about Crash”? Howard “Crash” Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, terrific. The other astronauts would love to go hurtling through space with a guy named Crash.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: All right, um, how about, oh, how about Rocket Man?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s not bad, Howard “Rocket Man” Wolowitz.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s great, but I told you, I don’t get to pick my nickname. It has to come from the other astronauts.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe there’s a way to get them to come up with it.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Like how?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Once I tried carrying around a Duncan yo-yo, hoping the other kids would start calling me Duncan.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Did it work?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, they ended up calling me Sock Mouth. Because they took away my yo-yo and stuffed their socks in my mouth.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, uh, what if we make Rocket Man your ringtone, and the next time you talk to those guys, I’ll call you and they’ll hear it. Plant the seed.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s actually not a terrible plan.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: They don’t call me Brown Dynamite for nothing.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (to Sheldon, entering)
utterance.content: ‘Sup?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: ‘Sup?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, did you ever make it to the dentist?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Not necessary. No. I found a service that’ll send a van to your house for a teeth cleaning. Mostly they cater to dogs, but the fellow on the phone seemed to have an open mind.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: All right, Sheldon, if you need me to take you to the dentist, I will take you to the dentist.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you suggesting that you’ve come to your senses and wish to re-establish the mutual benefits that stem from full participation in the roommate agreement?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Absolutely. If you admit that you’re a 30-year-old man who’s incapable of functioning on his own.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, Sock Mouth’s got him on the ropes.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I will admit nothing of the sort. And now if you’ll excuse me, I have to call my dentist and see if I can also get my hair shampooed and my nails clipped.

utterance.speaker: Penny (entering)
utterance.content: Oh, good, your power’s out, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why is that good?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Because last month, I sent the electric company a Starbucks gift card, an apology note, and a few snapshots of me in a bra.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Power failure. Implementing power-failure protocol.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What happened to all your glow-in-the-dark-emergency-exit stuff you had painted on the floor?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, that was wildly carcinogenic. Anyway, it’s too bad you’re no longer entitled to the full benefits of my friendship, because I happen to be extremely prepared for such an emergency. Please try not to see anything by this light. It’s not for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s just a blackout, I’m sure the power will be back on soon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I’m sure some fool in the Donner party said the snow would stop any day now. I like to think they ate him first.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, I got some candles in my apartment.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: But candles? During a blackout? Are you mad? That’s a fire hazard. No, Pasadena Water and Power recommends the far safer glow stick.

utterance.speaker: Leonard (pulling out a toy lightsabre)
utterance.content: You call that a glow stick? That is a glow stick. Come on, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Before you go, consider this. Not only do I have a deep-cycle marine battery power source which is more than capable of running our entertainment system, I also have all 61 episodes of the BBC series Red Dwarf and Fiddle-Faddle. All yours if you’re willing to reinstate the roommate agreement.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’ve got wine at my place and some bubble wrap we could pop.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, he’ll be back. Wine and a girl in the dark, he’s gonna be bored out of his mind.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: To wine and bubble wrap. And to not having to watch Sheldon demonstrate his reverse osmosis machine that converts urine into drinking water.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, in Girl Scouts, Tammie Dinisha said you could do that with panty hose. Boy, was she wrong. Anyway, you want to make out?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought because our relationship’s in a beta test, you wanted to take things slow.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay. Do you want to make out slow?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I can go so slow it’ll be like there’s a snail in your mouth.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Ugh. Well, lucky for you, there’s nothing else to do right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excuse me, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Since when don’t you knock? It’s like the only good thing about you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Social niceties have been suspended, Leonard. We’re in a state of a emergency. The world has descended into darkened turmoil. Lawlessness and savagery are the order of the day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m making s’mores. I wanted to alert you in case you smelled caramelizing marshmallows and thought a nearby candy factory was on fire.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: S’mores, huh? Good for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, or good for us if you sign here and reinstate the full roommate agreement.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, thanks. I’m good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Really? Huh! Okay. In that case, I will have a s’more by myself. And then I’m gonna have s’more. By myself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Aw.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, don’t aw him. He brought this all on himself.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: But he’s sad.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, he’s crazy. Sometimes crazy looks like sad so it’ll suck you back in.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I think he misses his little buddy.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Fine. But mark my words, this frustrating, bogus teenage make-out session is not over.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I thought you said candles were dangerous.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: This is a Bunsen burner. I’m a scientist, I know what I’m doing. Oh, drat. Aw. It took me a gallon of urine to make that water.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Listen, Sheldon, this is stupid. I don’t see why we can’t be friends. And I’m willing to drive you around and help you out with stuff. I just don’t want to do it because of some silly roommate agreement.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: What are you proposing?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That we go back to the way things were. But when I do something for you, you show a little appreciation.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And how would I do that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You say thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Every time?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not crazy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Counter-proposal. We reinstate the full roommate agreement with the following addendum, in the spirit of Mother’s Day or Father’s Day, once a year, we set aside day to celebrate all your contributions to my life, both actual and imagined by you. We could call it Leonard’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I kind of like the sound of that.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course you do. It’s about you, like everything else. Oh, thank goodness. I don’t think I had it in me to make another glass of water.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So, do I get breakfast in bed on Leonard’s Day?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can I sit in your spot?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Can I control the thermostat?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Do I get a card?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course you get a card. It’s Leonard’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, guys, the building manager said the reason the power went out is someone went down into the basement and just pulled the main breaker switch.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Really. Who do you think did that, Sheldon?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I don’t know. But whoever that mystery man was, you should be eternally grateful, for without him, there would be no Leonard’s Day.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard’s Day?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, no pressure. Just get him a crummy card, you’re good.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All right, test my ring tone. That really is a good song.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. There’s a reason he’s Sir Elton John. They don’t make you a knight for writing Wake Me Up Before You Go Go.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard, are you coming down for breakfast?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Ma, I told you I have a video conference with NASA. I said don’t bother me!

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Oh! Listen to Mr. Big Shot Astronaut.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, please listen to Mr. Big Shot Astronaut. Hey, good morning.

utterance.speaker: NASA Guy (on skype)
utterance.content: Hey, Howard, thanks for getting up so early.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No problem, Dr. Massimino.

utterance.speaker: Dr Massimino
utterance.content: The guys here call me Mass.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mass. That’s a cool nickname. ‘Cause force equals mass times acceleration.

utterance.speaker: Mass
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s just short for Massimino. Anyway, the plan for this morning is to go over the…

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry. My phone.

utterance.speaker: Mass
utterance.content: What is that? Is that Rocket Man?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, my ring tone. Kind of my favourite song, Rocket Man.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Wolowitz (off)
utterance.content: Howard, your Fruit Loops are getting soggy!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Not now!

utterance.speaker: Mass
utterance.content: Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My mom. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: No problem, Fruit Loops.
